results.title: Solomon Islands regain independence
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Graham Chase and Film Australia
results.brief_description: On July 7, 1978, Solomon Islands regained its independence from Britain. Looks at the people of these islands and studies their way of life through their comments, songs and dances. Describes the problems facing the new nation and what is being done to combat them. Pidgin dialogue, English dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Solomon Islands
results.creator_credit: Denmark, U-V Film and Video and Leif Stubkjaer,
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
This film examines the rich traditional and village life which continues alongside the adaption to modern ways. The Solomon Islands are a place of extreme contrasts even as the tides of change gradually affect these islands.

results.title: Solomon Island treasures
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Ian Walker
results.brief_description: Depicts Solomon Islands men and women displaying traditional skills and techniques. Provides an insight into the lifestyle of the people and the myths and legends interpreted in their art.

results.title: Solomon and Gaenor
results.creator_credit: Sheryl Crown, Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales), APT Film and Television and Paul Morrison
results.brief_description: Set against the Tredegar riots against Jewish shops in 1911, “Solomon and Gaenor” is a tragic love story of Jewish cloth merchant, Solomon (Ioan Gruffudd), and Gaenor (Nia Roberts), daughter of a struggling Welsh mining family. Solomon keeps his Jewish heritage a secret from his new love, who becomes frustrated by his inability to settle down and marry, and for the unspoken secrets between them. They are forced to re-evaluate their relationship when Gaenor falls pregnant and tensions mount between striking Welsh miners and Jewish storeholders, placing Solomon’s family in the front line. Director Paul Morrison asserts that the film is principally about the universal notion that we hide aspects of ourselves from those we love. He also manages to capture a painful chapter in the British Jewish experience. Cast also includes Sue Jones Davies, William Thomas and Mark Jones. In Welsh, Hebrew and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Solo: behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Phil Tucker
results.brief_description: Looks at how the film “Solo” was made, discussing some of the filming and climbing problems as well as the philosophy behind the film. Mike Hoover, the climber, talks about some of the stunts, and explains why he climbs mountains - the challenge, the dangers, problems and final gratification.

results.title: Solo whitewater
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, Bill Mason and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Path of the Paddle”.
This film explains clearly how to locate a deep water channel by reading the rapids and how to apply the many paddling strokes and manoeuvres to steer the canoe where you want it to go. It also depicts what happens if you make a mistake and “wipe out” in a turbulent rapid, and how to survive the swim. (Award: Venissieux.)

results.title: Solo basic
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, Bill Mason and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Path of the Paddle”.
The joy and poetry of paddling solo are illustrated in this film, as are all the basic strokes used in maintaining complete control of the canoe. With the aid of animated lines, the path of the paddle is clearly defined so there can be no mistaking what the paddle is doing. The use of the various strokes in rapids is demonstrated sufficiently to whet the appetite to move on.

results.title: Solo
results.creator_credit: David Adams, Pyramid Films and Mike Hoover
results.brief_description: Mike Hoover as the climber portrays the efforts and exhilarations that are experienced by the solo mountain climber. Filmed in Mexico, the United States and Canada on 21 different climbs this story explores the pleasures and dangers of mountain climbing by presenting three aspects of climbing of which the non-climber is rarely aware. These are the driving rhythm of sustained physical effort, the discovery of scenes and weathers unknown to others and the commitment to challenges which must be met alone.

results.title: Solo
results.brief_description:
Vincent is a cello player and occasional drug dealer. On his way back to Paris he is informed that his brother Virgile is accused of criminal acts perpetrated on behalf of a group of revolutionary students. In a race against time, Vincent decides to get to his runaway brother before the police does.

Credits: Producer, Gilbert Marion ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Alain Moury, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Georges Moustaki ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Sylvie Breal, Anne Deleuze, Denis Le Guillou, Henri Poirier, R. J. Chauffard.
